net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp

Class TcpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp.TcpServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hub<TcpCon>, InetHub<TcpCon>

    public class TcpServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements InetHub<TcpCon>
    TcpServer listens on the given port for new socket connections. When a new socket object is connected, it is used to create a TcpCon object. The new TcpCon object is added to the hub. When the connection is closed, it is automatically removed from the hub.
    Since:
    1.0

        acceptor - the acceptor to use

      • TcpServer

        public TcpServer(long localId,
         int port)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new TcpServer object with the given local id and port to listen on. A TcpAcceptor is constructed based on the given port.
        Parameters:
        localId - the local id of the hub
        port - the port acceptor will listen to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the acceptor

      • getLocalId

        public long getLocalId()
        Description copied from interface: InetHub

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the local id of the hub

      • getConnectionById

        public TcpCon getConnectionById(long id)
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        Searches stored connections for an id matching the supplied argument id. The id of stored connections is determined by Connection.getId().

        It is good practice when adding connections to the hub to not add multiple connections with same id. This can cause unexpected results.

        Specified by:
        getConnectionById in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the connection to return
        Returns:
        returns a connection with an id equal to connectionId. If no connection is found, null is returned.

      • getConnectionByIndex

        public TcpCon getConnectionByIndex(int index)
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        Returns a stored connection. This can be used to traverse all the stored connections. Connections are not Guaranteed to be in specific order. If index is less than zero or greater than Hub.getConnectionCount() then a IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getConnectionByIndex in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element to return.
        Returns:
        the connection at the specified index

      • getConnectionCount

        public int getConnectionCount()
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        Returns the number of connections that are stored. This can be used along with getConnectionByIndex to access all the stored connections.
        Specified by:
        getConnectionCount in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Returns:
        the amount of connections stored.

      • removeConnection

        public boolean removeConnection(TcpCon connection)
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        Removes a previously stored connection.
        Specified by:
        removeConnection in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to remove
        Returns:
        true if the connection was found and removed successfully

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(TcpCon connection)
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        Stores a connection. Once added, the connection can be retrieved using getConnectionById(long) and getConnectionByIndex(int)
        Specified by:
        addConnection in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to store
        Returns:
        true if the method was successful in adding the connection

      • sendMsg

        public boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg message,
              long connectionId)
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        Finds a connection whose getId() equals the supplied argument connectionId, and then sends the message via the found connection. Usually the message is sent by calling Connection.sendMsg(MarkupMsg) on the found connection.
        Specified by:
        sendMsg in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send
        connectionId - the id of the connection to use
        Returns:
        returns true if the message sent successfully or false if no connection was found or the sending the message failed

      • broadcastMsg

        public boolean broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg message)
        Description copied from interface: Hub
        The supplied MarkupMsg is sent to all stored connections. Usually this done by calling Connection.sendMsg(MarkupMsg) on each stored connection.
        Specified by:
        broadcastMsg in interface Hub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        message - the message sent to all stored connections
        Returns:
        true if the broadcast was successful, false otherwise

      • watchEvents

        Description copied from interface: InetHub

        Specified by:
        watchEvents in interface InetHub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • unwatchEvents

        public boolean unwatchEvents(ServerEventListener e)
        Description copied from interface: InetHub
        The event listener will no long be notified of events.
        Specified by:
        unwatchEvents in interface InetHub<TcpCon>
        Parameters:
        e - event listener to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the listener was found and removed successfully.
